explanation: A storybook is just paper and ink. It can't see you (Perception), learn anything (Learning), or talk to you (Natural Interaction) - the words stay the same every time!

name: ğŸ¤– Robot vacuum cleaner moving by itself
explanation: Robot vacuums use Perception to see obstacles with sensors, and Learning to remember your home's layout. That's how they find the best path without getting stuck!

name: ğŸ”Š Voice on a smart speaker answering questions
explanation: Smart speakers use Perception to hear your voice, Natural Interaction to understand what you're asking, and Learning to get better at answering your questions.

name: ğŸ® A video game character that responds to your playing style
explanation: This uses Learning - the game learns how you play and gets smarter! It also uses Representation & Reasoning to figure out what moves to make against you.

name: ğŸ“º Automatic captions on YouTube videos
explanation: YouTube uses Perception to listen to videos and Learning to turn speech into text. It learned from millions of examples of people talking!

name: ğŸ“² Phone unlocking with your face
explanation: Face unlock uses Perception to see your face with a camera, and Learning to recognise that it's really you - not someone else or a photo!

name: ğŸŒ Translation app that listens and speaks in another language
explanation: Translation apps use Perception to hear you speak, Learning to understand languages, and Natural Interaction to talk back to you in another language!

name: ğŸš² A bicycle you ride to school
explanation: A bicycle is powered by you! It uses gears and wheels - no Perception, no Learning, no thinking at all. You're the smart one riding it!

name: ğŸ A toaster that browns bread
explanation: A toaster just heats up for the time you set. It can't see (Perception) how brown your toast is or learn (Learning) how you like it.

name: ğŸ“» A radio that plays music when you turn it on
explanation: A basic radio just receives signals and plays them as sound. It doesn't have Perception to know what you like or Learning to pick better songs for you.

name: ğŸ“º A regular TV remote
explanation: A TV remote just sends simple signals when you press buttons. No Perception, no Learning, no Natural Interaction - it only does exactly what you tell it!

name: ğŸ“· A printed photo album
explanation: A photo album is just printed pictures in a book. Unlike phone apps that use Perception and Learning to recognise faces, it can't organise anything by itself.

name: ğŸ”¦ A flashlight that turns on with a switch
explanation: A flashlight is a simple circuit - flip the switch and light comes on. No Perception, no Learning, no thinking involved!

name: ğŸ•°ï¸ A clock with hands that tick
explanation: An analog clock uses gears to move the hands. It tells time through mechanics, not through Perception or Learning like a smartwatch would.
